title: MD
biography: David Jay Julius is an American physiologist and Nobel Prize laureate known for his work on molecular mechanisms of pain sensation and heat, including the characterization of the TRPV1 and TRPM8 receptors that detect capsaicin, menthol, and temperature. He is a professor at the University of California, San Francisco.
aiSummary: David Julius is a nobel prize specialist with an H-index of 95 at UCSFNeuroscience (Member). Has been published in Nature Medicine, Nature Immunology, The Lancet Neurology. Based in Unknown, Unknown, Global.
